Staying hidden? It's all about blending in, being a ghost in the machine.

First, you gotta ditch the obvious. No flashy exploits, no bragging rights on dark web forums. I'm talking low and slow, using custom tools, zero-days I've stockpiled, and techniques nobody else is using.

Second, I disappear in the noise. I piggyback on legitimate traffic, bury my activity in the endless stream of data. I use VPNs, proxies, Tor, you name it, constantly shifting, never staying in one place for too long.

Third, I make sure my targets never suspect me. I study them, learn their routines, their weaknesses. I hit them where it hurts, but I make it look like an inside job, a disgruntled employee, anything but me.

The key is to be patient, meticulous, a shadow. The more invisible I am, the longer I stay in the game. And the more money I make.
